perturbation.original_text: Licensor grants to Rogers the non-exclusive license and right to distribute and exhibit in Canada (the “Territory”) all entertainment programming to which Licensor owns or controls the VOD distribution and exhibition rights in the Territory (collectively, “Licensed Programs”) to residential subscribers of Rogers’ digital cable television service on a Video-on-Demand (“VOD”) basis. For clarity, the VOD service that Rogers provides to such subscribers shall hereinafter be referred to as the “ROD Service”.
perturbation.changed_text: The Content Provider grants to Rogers the non-exclusive license and right to distribute and exhibit in Canada (the “Territory”) all entertainment programming to which the Rights Holder owns or controls the VOD distribution and exhibition rights in the Territory (collectively, “Licensed Programs”) to residential subscribers of Rogers’ digital cable television service on a Video-on-Demand (“VOD”) basis. For clarity, the VOD service that Rogers provides to such subscribers shall hereinafter be referred to as the “ROD Service”.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Licensor', 'Content Provider', and 'Rights Holder' are used interchangeably, creating confusion about the responsibilities and rights of the content provider.

perturbation.original_text: Licensor shall, at its sole expense, encode each Licensed Program selected for distribution and exhibition by Rogers hereunder and shall deliver such fully encoded Licensed Program to Rogers on a DLT master tape, DVD-R disc or other master pre-recorded format acceptable to Rogers (each, a “Master”) at least thirty (30) days prior to the availability date for such Licensed Program. Such Masters shall at all times remain the sole property of Licensor and, within fifteen (15) days following the termination or expiration of this Agreement, Rogers shall either return to Licensor all such Masters then in its possession, or issue a certificate of erasure.
perturbation.changed_text: The Rights Holder shall, at its sole expense, encode each Licensed Program selected for distribution and exhibition by Rogers hereunder and shall deliver such fully encoded Licensed Program to Rogers on a DLT master tape, DVD-R disc or other master pre-recorded format acceptable to Rogers (each, a “Master”). Said media must be delivered at least ten (10) days prior to the availability date for such Licensed Program. Such Masters shall at all times remain the sole property of Licensor and, within fifteen (15) days following the termination or expiration of this Agreement, Rogers shall either return to Licensor all such Masters then in its possession, or issue a certificate of erasure.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Licensor' and 'Rights Holder' are used interchangeably. This creates confusion because although the media is the sole property of the Licensor, 'Rights Holder' delivers the masters. Also, the contradictory delivery timeframe of 30 vs. 10 days creates uncertainty in delivery obligations.

perturbation.original_text: In consideration for various services and activities that Rogers performs for the benefit of Licensor during the Term, Licensor agrees to pay to Rogers an amount which shall be equal to ten (10)% of License Fees, calculated on a rolling basis during the Term and payable monthly.
perturbation.changed_text: In consideration for various services and activities that Rogers performs for the benefit of the Content Provider during the Term, the Rights Holder agrees to pay to Rogers an amount which shall be equal to twenty (20)% of License Fees, calculated on a quarterly basis during the Term and payable after each quarter.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Licensor', 'Content Provider', and 'Rights Holder' are used interchangeably, creating confusion about which entity is responsible for the marketing allowance. Also, the marketing allowance obligation is changed to 20% and paid quarterly, in contradiction to the monthly 10% that Licensor is obligated to pay.
